title: Custom Box::new throws error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![no_std] #![feature(lang_items, start)] #[lang = "owned_box"] struct Box(*mut T); #[lang = "exchange_malloc"] unsafe fn alloc() -> *mut u8 { core::ptr::null_mut() } #[lang = "box_free"] unsafe fn free(ptr: *mut T) { } impl Box { pub fn new(val: T) -> Box { Box::new(val) } } #[start] fn main(i: isize, args: *const *const u8) -> isize { let x = Box::new(3); 0 } #[panic_handler] fn panic_handler(_: &core::panic::PanicInfo) -> ! { loop {} } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.63.0-nightly (b31f9cc22 2022-06-15) binary: rustc commit-hash: b31f9cc22bcd720b37ddf927afe378108a5b9a54 commit-date: 2022-06-15 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.63.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.5 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1', /rustc/b31f9cc22bcd720b37ddf927afe378108a5b9a54/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/subst.rs:363:43 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/b31f9cc22bcd720b37ddf927afe378108a5b9a54/library/std/src/panicking.rs:584:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/b31f9cc22bcd720b37ddf927afe378108a5b9a54/library/core/src/panicking.rs:142:14 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check at /rustc/b31f9cc22bcd720b37ddf927afe378108a5b9a54/library/core/src/panicking.rs:84:5 3: rustc_codegen_llvm::debuginfo::metadata::type_di_node 4: ::create_dbg_var 5: rustc_codegen_ssa::mir::codegen_mir:: 6: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit::module_codegen 7: >::with_task::> 8: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit 9: ::codegen_crate 10: ::time::, rustc_interface::passes::start_codegen::{closure#0}> 11: ::enter::<::ongoing_codegen::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result, rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 12: ::ongoing_codegen 13: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 14: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 15: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.63.0-nightly (b31f9cc22 2022-06-15) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
